greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Same as A000179, except that a(0) = 2.
comment: For any integer n>=0, 2 * Integral_{t=-2..2} T_n(t/2)*exp(-t)*dt = 4 * Integral_{z=-1..1} T_n(z)*exp(-2*z)*dz = a(n)*exp(2) - A300484(n)*exp(-2). - _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 08 2018
reference: J. Riordan, An Introduction to Combinatorial Analysis, Wiley, 1958, p. 197.
link: Vladimir Shevelev, Spectrum of permanent's values and its extremal magnitudes in Λ_n^3 and Λ_n(α,β,γ), arXiv:1104.4051 [math.CO], 2011.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i=0..n} A127672(n,i) * A000023(i). - _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 06 2018
program: (PARI) { A102761(n) = subst( serlaplace( 2*polchebyshev(n, 1, (x-2)/2)), x, 1); } \\ _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 06 2018
xref: A000179, A102761, and A335700 are all essentially the same sequence but with different conventions for the initial terms a(0) and a(1). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 06 2020
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 04 2010, following a suggestion from _Vladimir Shevelev_
ext: Changed a(0)=2 (making the sequence more consistent with existing formulae) by _Max Alekseyev_, Mar 06 2018
